Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394536) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394536)
